710829f-a.text:
38 East First Street, north side between First and Second Avenues, showing P.S. 79.

Board of Education, N.Y.C.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE. 1920

NEG. 2867

719488f-a.text:
East Houston Street, at, and adjoining the S.E. corner of Allen Street, showing a 2½-story frame house (at the corner) bearing No. 208 Allen Street. The 4-story house adjoining it is No. 173 East Houston Street. Both houses were later demolished for the widening of Allen Street, where a portion of the Second Ave. Elevated Line is conspicuously visible.
June 21, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
719488f-a.folder: Houston Street (East) & Allen Street, Manhattan, NY

707496f-a.text:
First Avenue and Allen Street, west side, south of East 1st Street, as viewed from the 2nd Avenue "El" platform. These two thoroughfares are continuous, with Houston Street the dividing line. Buildings on the right, between 1st and Houston Streets, are being razed preparatory to the 8th Avenue Subway construction. Subsequent to this, a playground will be constructed here. The photographer is viewing south westward from the north bound platform.
February 17, 1928
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
Neg. #967

710842f-a.text:
Neg. no. 266
1st Street, east from the Bowery, as photographed from under the Third Avenue "El". In the background, on First Avenue, is a station of the Second Avenue "El" Line. Between these two similar transportation features is Second Avenue. The three story carved corner building at the right was the infamous Suicide Hall.
The owner was "Bloody" McGurk.
July 1928
George L. Balgue, photo

719490f-b.text:
175 to 183 East Houston Street, south side, from Allen (right), east to Orchard Streets. lIn the foreground is shown construction work on the Independent System Subway(Eimbth Ave. subway). Also visible (right) is Allen Street, east side, south from Eaat Houston Street. No. 208 Allen Street, a 2i -story frame house that stood at this corner in 1927 is now gone. The adjoining building No. 173 East Houston Street was dehmolished at the same time; both as a part of the widen4ng project of
Allen Street.
June 6, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

707493f-a.text:
First Avenue, east aide, north from East Houston (extreme right and not seen), to E. 1st Street (buildings thereupon). At the latter point is the station of the Second Aveue Elevated Lire running on 1stt Aveue. Note the individuuals retailing food stuffs and merchandise. Theae form a part of the overflow of the Orcward Street market. 707501f-a.text:
First hvenue, east side, north from 58 First Avenue between 3rd and
4th Streets.
June 25, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

707495f.text:
First Avenue, west side, from Houston to 1st Streets, at the beginning of First Avenue. The view is shut off by the 1st Street Elevated Station. There is a broad plaza here where 1st and Houston Streets come together; most of the old buildings eere torn out around 1930 when a branch of the Eighth Avenue City Subway was dug under
HEouston Street.
June 25, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

719489f-b.text:
(1)
East Houston Street (where vehicles are seen) east from Allen Street, showing the clearance created between East Houston and East lst Streets, by the demolition of tenements which faced on the north side of the former and the south side of the latter streets. Note construction going on for the Independent System Subway (Eighth Ave. subway). Also shown (left) is East 1st Street, north side, east from (No. 84) but not including First Ave. The cleared area is now (1937) being utilised
as a playground.
May 9, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date, as seen from First Ave. (a continuation of Allen Street), showing a portion of the Second Ave. Elevated Line
on Allen Street.
March 13, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
719489f-b.folder: Houston Street (East) & Allen Street, Manhattan, NY

710833f-a.text:
98-84 1st Street, north side, east of First Avenue, also showing the building adjoining the corner. The view is from Essex Street looking northwest along the clearing for a curve of the Brooklyn line of the city-owned Eighth Avenue subway.
May 9, 1930.
P. 1  .. Sperr.
ege 197
The same, not showing 78-80 1st Street. The subway is completed,
but has not been put into operation.

710838f-a.text:
East 1st Street, east from, but not including First Ave. The view shows a clearance for subway and park construction. Buildings shown on the extreme right, are on East Houston Street, south side, east of Orchard Street.
April 28, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

710840f-b.text:
(1) Neg. No. 222
1st Street, north side, from First Avenue to a point just ast of Second Avenue.

September 20, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

(2) Neg No 222
The same, at a slightly earlier date, showing a more extensive view, to and including the Bowery. At the left appears East Houston Street west from Eldridge Street. The cleared area, between 1st and East Houston Streets was created by the demolition of the buildings which formerly occupied the south side of the former and the east side of the latter streets, to facilitate the construction of the Independent System (Eighth Ave.) Subway.

June 6, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
